text: Mohammad Fahad Muflih al-Qahtani (, born 1965/1966) is a Saudi economics professor and co-founder of the Saudi Arabian human rights organization Saudi Civil and Political Rights Association (ACPRA). On 9 March 2013, al-Qahtani was sentenced to ten years in prison and ten years of travel ban. In 2018, he was awarded the Right Livelihood Award.3 Saudi human rights activists awarded "Alternative Nobel", Jan M. Olsen, Fox News, September 24, 2018 ==References== Category:1960s births Category:Living people Category:Saudi Arabian human rights activists Category:Saudi Arabian academics
title: Mohammad Fahad al-Qahtani
